Generation IV.Diamond: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
Generation IV.Pearl: It lives along shores in northern countries. A skilled swimmer, it dives for over 10 minutes to hunt.
Generation IV.Platinum: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It doesn't like to be taken care of. It's difficult to bond with since it won't listen to its Trainer.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It lives along the shore in northern countries. A skilled swimmer, it dives for over 10 minutes while hunting.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It's an adorable little thing—as cute as any child—but it's also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.

Generation IX.Scarlet: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
Generation IX.Violet: It doesn’t like to be taken care of. It’s difficult to bond with since it won’t listen to its Trainer.

Generation IV.Diamond: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity
Generation IV.Pearl: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity
Generation IV.Platinum: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase on Route 201

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after entering the Hall of Fame twice
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after entering the Hall of Fame twice

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity Grand Underground - Fountainspring Cave , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity Grand Underground - Fountainspring Cave , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Cobalt Coastlands : near Spring Path , near Islespy Shore ( mass outbreaks ), massive mass outbreaks

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Received as an Egg from Jacq on Reveler's Road (random between Turtwig, Chimchar and Piplup) Polar Biome (after boosting biodiversity in the Polar Biome)
